result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 
To be paid during the period of probation on a schedule arranged between the agent and the defendant. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No abusive contact with Jennifer Wojtalewicz.

Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Provide DNA sample.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:28 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
Atty Schmidt has no changes or corrections to the revocation packet

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
1 year jail sentence - concurrent to all sentences currently being served
Sentence to commence immediately

Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 20, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court, in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:26 p.m.  Court calls the case and states the appearances. 

Court reviews the file.  The public defender has not been contacted to appoint counsel for the defendant. 
Atty Knaapen informs the Court that the defendant has 2 other files set for revocation on 12/9/16 in Br 1.  Asks the court if this matter could be heard at that time in Br 1 as well.  Believes this court would need to speak with Judge Eagon.  
Defendant makes statements.  Believes that attorney Karl Schmidt was assigned to cover all of his files.  He has not had any contact with him. 
Court reviews the 14CF53 file.   The Revocation Order and Warrant was sent to the Public Defender asking for counsel to be appointed.  
Defendant makes additional statements, spoke with the Public Defender and he was told Atty Schmidt was appointed. 

BY THE COURT:  This matter is on hold in the hopes it will be held on 12/9/16 at 9:30 a.m. in Br 1.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:31 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 as set forth in the information.
State recommends withheld, 24 mo prob, obt/mtn ft emt, counseling recommended, agent's discretion as to no contact, provide DNA sample, pay court costs, pay DNA surcharge, pay domestic abuse surcharge.

Atty Kuhl concurs.

Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Defendant agrees there are previous convictions.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 947.01 and 939.621 1b2

Neither party is asking for a PSI.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding a possible straight jail sentence but Defendant is willing to do another period of probation. State is willing to give Defendant the opportunity of probaiton.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kuhl makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court agrees with the recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Maintain full time employment
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent
No abusive contact with Jennifer Wojtalewicz
Provide DNA sample 
Pay court costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay domestic abuse surcharge
To be paid during period of probation on a schedule arranged between agent and Defendant
